circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Jason Scott Adkins was fishing on the Ohio River with his brother on Jan. 17, 1999, when the boat they were in had engine failure. The men's boat capsized after a passing barge caused a series of large waves.  Adkins disappeared and has not been heard from since. No trace of Jason Scott Adkins was located in the river, and it is unclear if he drowned.

Press conference indicated that the last known sighting of Aigeltinger was on Sept. 8 when he stopped at a Sheetz gas station in Manassas Park, Virginia at 7:05 p.m. Aigeltinger was scheduled to arrive at a school in Price William County, Virginia at 1 p.m. on Sept. 9 where he was to provide photography services. He did not arrive there or at his employer's office. "No phone calls, vehicle sightings or evidence of credit card or cell phone records have been found that definitely tell us where he was since the afternoon prior when he and his vehicle were at a Sheetz gas station.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: A five-year-old missing person's case ended up with two men arrested Wednesday evening, charged with the murder of a Logan County man. West Virginia State Police troopers say five years after Willy Williams was reported missing, some new leads jump started the investigation. Freelin Vance of Logan, and Anthony Baisden of Mingo County both face first-degree murder charges. Troopers say they picked up both men Wednesday, and that they both admitted to being involved in Williams' death to some extent. http://www.wsaz.com/content/news/Two-charged-with-murder-in-connection-to-missing-person-case--363877921.html

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance:
Melissa Moreland left her father's home October 23, 1987, and disappeared. She was last seen late that night at the former High’s gas station in Paw Paw. Her parents believed she would be spending the night with a friend. 

Moreland lived with her parents in Hampshire County near Paw Paw. She would come and go from the home, so some time had passed before she was initially reported missing.

clothingAndAccessoriesArticles.description: A white blouse, blue jeans.
high-top tennis shoes
A Hampshire High School class ring from 1984 and a watch with a burgundy band.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance:
Starina Woods was last known to be alive on March 10-11, 2016 at her home in Charleston WV.  Investigators determined that Starina Woods was in a domestic altercation with her husband/spouse at their home leading up to her disappearance.   

Starina Woods was not reported missing until May 19, 2016 by a family member.  

Investigators have found foul play present and the last person to see Starina Woods alive was her husband.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance:
Steven Berry was just starting his senior year in 1986, a member of the Tau Kappa Epsilon (TKE) fraternity and the senior senator in student government.

July 24th of 1986 would be the last time anyone would remember seeing him.  Berry left his apartment at 1108 Fennimore Street, right across from campus, just before 2:00 p.m.

Later that day, his 1983 Chevrolet Chevette was found parked at the Pittsburgh Airport.

"There's no indication that he was even personally at the airport, that he even made it there."

vehicles.comment: His 1983 Chevrolet Chevette was found parked at the Pittsburgh Airport.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance:
John DeMarino went missing on Wednesday, January 30th, 2019 and has never been seen nor heard from again.
About 10:30 - 11:00 pm on January 30th, 2019 John DeMarino left his mother's house in Spencer WV, where he had been living for 5 months, and drove her 2015 silver Ford Escape to Uncle Mike's Bar and Grill 706 7th St, Parkersburg, WV 26101) in Parkersburg WV.  Sometime between 11:30 pm and right before midnight, John arrived at Uncle Mikes, sat at the bar, ordered a beer and about 30 minutes later went to use the restroom. He hasn't been seen or heard from since. 
On Friday February 8th, Jane's 2015 silver Ford Escape was reported abandoned at a Love's Truck Stop in Conneaut, Ohio. According to staff, the car had been taking up two spaces and had been parked there for about 3-4 days. The car was unlocked, no keys were found, there was a full cup of change, a phone charger and an empty bag of chips, but no sign of John. The WV State police called Jane and told her they found her car.

clothingAndAccessoriesArticles.description: John was last seen wearing tan khaki pants, brown work boots, a red hoodie under a green winter jacket and a black beanie hat. He had his wallet, car keys and his iPhone X on him.

physicalDescription.headHairDescription: John is completely balding on the top but had some graying, very short hair on the sides of his head. He liked to shave his head, bald.  John has a scar on the back of his head, that looks like 3-4 rows of about 8 white circles, where hair was removed.
physicalDescription.bodyHairDescription: John has hair on his chest
physicalDescription.facialHairDescription: John kept his face clean shaved, maybe didn't shave for a day or two max.
physicalDescription.eyeDescription: very dark brown, almost black eyes

physicalFeatureDescriptions.description:
John has several tattoos...an infinity symbol on his upper left arm, some arrows and circles in red and black on inner right arm. The Roman numeral    X111   on his upper right arm
He always wears a beanie on his head

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Eugene Godfrey last spoke with a neighbor on the 8th of October, 2024. It is unknown how he left the area.

Seif's father took Seif to his home county of Yemen for a two week visit and he never returned. 

Father worked at Weirton Steel Mill in Weirton, West Virginia. After he never returned, Seif's mom went to the Steel Mill to see if they had heard from him and they told her that he never worked there under that name. He had used an alias name to marry her. To this day, no one knows what his real name was/is. The Department of Immigration has no record of him under that name.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: It was June 2, 1987, and Tammy was hanging out at the El Cid Club in Beckley, police said. Tammy’s parents,  picked her up around 3 a.m. and drove her back to her trailer. The door was locked, so Tammy decided to stay in a tent in the yard. That was the last time that her parents ever saw her. Her parents swung by her house the next morning, but Tammy wasn’t home. Her husband,  said he asked her to leave and that he didn’t know where she was. Several hours passed and Tammy still hadn’t been heard from. Four days later, Tammy’s parents filed a missing person’s report with the Raleigh County Sheriff’s Office.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance:
Wanda Fay Branham, 68, was last seen February 7 and, according to family members and investigators. Investigators say her family reported she was missing on February 15. An eyewitness reported possibly seeing Branham in a red 1980s model Chevrolet truck type of truck around the time she would have went missing.

The witness told deputies it appeared to be Branham sitting in the middle between two unknown men. The witness described the truck as sounding "very loud."

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance:
Lockhart was last seen on March 28 at the Kroger Grocery Store in Moundsville, WV. 

According to police, the last contact she had with anyone appears to be on April 2, 2015, via a telephone conversation. Prior to her disappearance, she was living in Friendly, WV, but she also has ties to Steubenville, Ohio, and Weirton, WV.

The family of Nicole Lockhart is prepared to give a $1,000 reward to anyone who has information which assists in locating her.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Grace left her mother's residence on 2-23-22 around 830pm in her vehicle.  Mother attempted to contact her via cell phone at approximately 1130 pm same date with no answer.  Numerous calls were made to Grace's phone over the following 24 hrs. with no answer.  Grace's vehicle was located abandoned on 2-25-22 in the McClintic Wildlife area with her personal belongings inside and the keys laying on the hood.  This location was approximately 10 miles from Grace's mother's residence.  Grace made no phone calls from her cell phone after leaving her mother's residence on 2-23-22.

During the November 1985 Flood, Catherine B. McMillion climbed onto the roof of a flood ravaged house trailer to escape the rising water, and was able to cling to a small tree using her belt for some time before falling from the tree into the flood swollen stream and was swept away. Victim believed to have drowned, and her body is still missing.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: On or about 7 Dec 63, Haynes departed Baltimore, MD and started hitchhiking to Maben, West Virginia to visit his parents. Haynes was reportedly driven from Baltimore, MD to the intersection of Highways 40 and 340 near Frederick, MD, by his brother-in-law. He left his brother-in-law's vehicle at approximately 0600, 7 Dec 63, at which time he was wearing his Class "A" (Army Green) uniform. He had been carrying a suitcase, and had approximately $8.00 in his possession. A witness reported to the West Virginia State Police that during the early hours of 7 Dec 63, she had picked up a hitchhiking soldier near Frederick, MD, and drove him to the intersection of US Highway 21 and West Virginia Highway 61, Oak Hill, WV, letting him out of her vehicle about 1400-1500 hours. The soldier who obtained a ride stated his name was "Haynes" and he was enroute to visit his parents in Maben, WV (Oak Hill is approximately 49 miles from Maben, WV). Haynes has not been seen or heard from since 7 Dec 63. All efforts by Army CID, West Virginia State Police, and local civil authorities met with negative efforts in locating Haynes. There were no indications that Haynes had deserted the U.S. Army. Foul play is suspected.

clothingAndAccessoriesArticles.description: Carrying a gray suitcase and had approximately $8.00 in his possession
Military Class A (Army green dress) uniform

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance:
Last seen at his home Christmas Eve in Logan County. Police are looking for an elderly Logan County man, who suffers from dementia, after his truck was found abandoned in Belle.West Virginia State Police are looking for Walter Lowell Edmunds, 79, of Chapmanville, after his pickup was found Monday in a ditch near Riverside High School, according to a news release. Edmunds' family members told police they have not seen him for three or four days.Police were searching Tuesday in heavily forested areas and nearby waterways. No one is sure what Edmunds was doing in Kanawha County, and police said he was traveling alone. Relatives said he has dementia.

https://www.wvgazettemail.com/news/cops_and_courts/police-looking-for-elderly-man-missing-in-kanawha-county/article_4a4646cb-aab8-5962-8353-09b7efbd7474.html

notes.description:
CHARLESTON, W.Va. -- Even though police have stopped actively searching for an elderly Logan County man whose truck was found abandoned last month in Belle, they say they still believe he's alive.State Police Trooper E.B. McClung said foot searches were called off last week for Walter Lowell Edmunds, 79, of Chapmanville."As it stands there are no boots on the pavement and no planes in the air, but we will follow up on any leads that come in," McClung said.Relatives last saw Edmunds, who suffers from dementia, in Logan County over Christmas weekend.On Dec. 26, his pickup truck was found abandoned in a ditch near Riverside High School in Belle.Several callers erroneously reported seeing Edmunds in Logan, Kanawha and Boone counties, McClung said.Steve Shanklin, chief of West Virginia K9 Search and Rescue, said his all-volunteer group has been assisting police in searches in Belle and Quincy. Several searches with K9s and people in wooded areas and along waterways yielded no clues, he said.Shanklin said the search has hit a dead end, but his group will continue looking as leads come in.Edmunds has not accessed his bank accounts or returned to his home since being reported missing, McClung said.According to a Silver Alert, Edmunds is about 5 feet 11 inches tall and weighs about 144 pounds.It would be unusual for Edmunds wear anything other than a flannel shirt and blue jeans, McClung said.Relatives said Edmunds has no business or apparent connections in Belle. However, Edmunds would visit Charleston about once a week to eat dinner at Ryan's restaurant on Corridor G, McClung said.McClung was not sure if Edmunds was on his way to eat dinner the day he disappeared.It's difficult for police to track dementia or Alzheimer's suffers because their actions are unpredictable, McClung said."Sometimes they show up in other states," he said. "It's strange how they act and behave."Police are assuming that Edmunds is traveling by public transportation and by foot.Anyone with information on his whereabouts is urged to call the Logan detachment of the State Police at 304-792-7200.

https://www.wvgazettemail.com/news/police-hit-dead-end-in-search-for-missing-logan-county/article_49dfffb9-70b2-5f74-a36d-bbf319365748.html

clothingAndAccessoriesArticles.description: It would be unusual for Edmunds wear anything other than a flannel shirt and blue jeans.

vehicles.comment: Vehicle located behind Riverside High School in Kanawha County, WV

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: According to West Virginia State Police, David Lee Adkins of Bloomingrose, was reported missing by his wife. She told investigators that her husband and at least three other men were stealing copper from inside the sealed Upper Big Branch Mine. One of the men, was arrested on Wednesday. A second man, was arrested on Friday. Both men are charged with breaking and entering at the mine. Bennett reportedly told investigators that he had been with Adkins inside the mine around 2:30 a.m. Tuesday, but that the two separated. In an interview with WVVA on Friday, Adkins' mother, said she believes there is more to the story. She said her son and his wife had a troubled history, parting ways just days before her son disappeared. "He disappeared. He and his wife got into an argument. She wanted him to go out in the mountains and steal copper. He said he didn't want to and he didn't like it and he left, said Adkins. "My heart feels like it's just breaking in two. I've never experienced anything like this except when my grandson died last year. That was the worst part. But this, this is killing me...not knowing if he's alive or anything."

Kevin Flythe was driven from FCI Gilmer, located in Glenville, WV, to the Charleston, WV Greyhound bus station.  He was dropped off at 6:32 am on 1/27/22; this is the last confirmed sighting.  Kevin was supposed to get on a Barons Bus that left at 9:50 am and eventually arrive in DC on a Greyhound bus on 1/28 at approximately 3:20 am (although his scheduled bus was 50 minutes late).  Per his itinerary, he was supposed to travel through Cambridge (Ohio), Cleveland, Pittsburgh, Baltimore, and DC.  He hasn't been seen since.

notes.description:
Kevin supposed to travel the following bus schedule: 
Charleston, WV - Departure 9:50 am on 1/27/22
Cambridge, OH - Arrival 12:40 pm; Departure 1:00 pm
Cleveland, OH - Arrival 3:30 pm; Departure 4:55 pm
Pittsburgh, PA - Arrival 8:15 pm; Departure 9:15 pm
Baltimore, MA - Arrival 1:50 am (1/28/22); Departure 2:25 am
Washington, DC - Arrival 3:25 am (scheduled); Bus actually arrived 52 minutes late

During the Flood of 1985, Cathy Huffman and her husband were attempting to get to their home, her husband crossed a flooded water way and was almost swept away by the current but managed to grab a tree branch and make it to the opposite bank, he advised Cathy to stay put and he would go get a chainsaw to down a tree so that she could use it as a bridge to cross the swollen water way. He returned to the bank where he had left Cathy and she was nowhere to be found, the victim was either swept away by a dammed up wall of water, or fell into the stream, while trying to cross to the southside of the stream and was washed away. The victim's purple jacket was later found 300-400 yards downstream east of her last known location, and about 150 feet further down from the jacket was the victim's blouse that was turned inside out snagged on a locust limb, about 2/3 of the blouse was covered with rock. The victim's body has not been recovered.

images.caption: Photo of Cathy Marie Huffman published in " Before, During and After The Flood of Pendleton County" Complied and Edited by Margaret R. Wimer

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Gretchen Fleming was last seen with a male subject known to law enforcement leaving the My Way Lounge located at 501 Juliana Street, Parkersburg, WV at approximately 0310 hrs on 12/4/22 leaving her purse with her cell phone and other personal documents behind.   Ms. Fleming was not reported missing to law enforcement until 12/12/22.  Ms. Fleming has not had any contact with her family and has not made any attempt to retrieve her purse and cell phone, which law enforcement currently has custody of.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: She was hitch hiking into town to pay a bill or she was hitch hiking to go work in Ohio. She is believed to have disappeared sometime in 1948-1950, exact time is unknown.
